body_html:
Below is the code that I tried. The problem is collections in meta_graph is not updated for new graph from auto_parallel. So I can't access variables or queue_runner for new graph. Moreover, snapshot ops for variables, and operations of condition context collection are removed through auto_parallel.

 with tf.Graph().as_default():
    meta_graph_def = meta_graph_pb2.MetaGraphDef()
    meta_graph_def.ParseFromString(meta_graph_def_str)
    tf.import_meta_graph(meta_graph_def)

    rewriter_config = rewriter_config_pb2.RewriterConfig()
    rewriter_config.optimizers.append('autoparallel')
    rewriter_config.auto_parallel.num_replicas = num_replicas

    graph_def = tf_optimizer.OptimizeGraph(rewriter_config, meta_graph_def)
    tf.import_graph_def(graph_def=graph_def, name='')

    meta_graph_def = tf.train.export_meta_graph()

body:
Below is the code that I tried. The problem is collections in meta_graph is not updated for new graph from auto_parallel. So I can't access variables or queue_runner for new graph. Moreover, snapshot ops for variables, and operations of condition context collection are removed through auto_parallel.

```
 with tf.Graph().as_default():
    meta_graph_def = meta_graph_pb2.MetaGraphDef()
    meta_graph_def.ParseFromString(meta_graph_def_str)
    tf.import_meta_graph(meta_graph_def)

    rewriter_config = rewriter_config_pb2.RewriterConfig()
    rewriter_config.optimizers.append('autoparallel')
    rewriter_config.auto_parallel.num_replicas = num_replicas

    graph_def = tf_optimizer.OptimizeGraph(rewriter_config, meta_graph_def)
    tf.import_graph_def(graph_def=graph_def, name='')

    meta_graph_def = tf.train.export_meta_graph()
```
